name: 鄭麗珍
objective:
E-Marketing involves information technology and marketing. The course will explore information technology/systems concepts from a non-technical perspective and examine how the marketing function is influenced by emerging technology trends. In addition, some famous e-marketing technique would be introduced in this course including recommended system, customer segmentation and so on.   
This course also discusses the journal paper to enhance the students' theoretical base
NOTE: This is an advanced course.   Student should take  a prerequirement course "Big Data Analytics". Student also should familiar with python
schedule:
Part I: e marketing concepts 
1. E marketing in context 
2. E marketing environment 
3. E marketing strategy  
4. D E marketing management 

Part II: Data analysis of E marketing concepts 
1. Recommended system  
2. Opinion mining 
3. Social network analysis 
4 .Customer segmentation  

Part III: paper presentation 
Part IV: project presentation
scorePolicy:
Attendance: 10%
Participation and discussion every week: 30%
Paper presentation ~30%
final  term project: 30%
materials:
Data Mining for Business Analytics: Concepts, Techniques, and Applications in Python (First Edition) Galit Shmueli, Peter C. Bruce, Peter Gedeck, and Nitin R. Patel (c) 2019 John Wiley & Sons, Inc.

Bing Liu Sentiment Analysis : Mining Opinions, Sentiments, and Emotions, 2015
E-marketing 8th edition, Raymond D. Frost, Alexa Fox, Judy Strauss, 2018 
Recent academic papers, tutorials, and slides.
